citations.title: [Masakhane]( African language NLP (includes some indigenous languages)
[Te Hiku Media]( Māori speech recognition and synthesis
[Endangered Languages Project]( Documentation, limited NLP
[Indigenous Language Technologies]( (AmericasNLP Workshop, ACL 2020)
[Te Hiku Media Māori ASR]( — Community-led speech tech
[Endangered Language Documentation]( — Current manual methods
[Speech-to-Text for Low-Resource Languages]( (arXiv, 2023)
[Data Augmentation for Low-Resource NMT]( (ACL, 2020)
[Masakhane: Machine Translation for African Languages]( (arXiv, 2020)
[Indigenous Data Sovereignty]( — CARE Principles for Indigenous Data
[Ethical AI for Indigenous Communities]( (arXiv, 2021)
[Multimodal LLMs]( (arXiv, 2023) — General multimodal models
[Visual Storytelling]( (arXiv, 2016) — Image + text generation
**Example**: Te Hiku Media (Māori) developed [Kaitiakitanga License]( for their speech data—community retains control.
**Example**: [Local Contexts]( provides labels for indigenous data governance.
[NSF Documenting Endangered Languages](
[NEH Preservation and Access](
[Endangered Languages Documentation Programme](
1. **[Indigenous Language Technologies]( (AmericasNLP Workshop, ACL 2020) — Overview of indigenous language NLP
2. **[CARE Principles for Indigenous Data Governance]( (Carroll et al., Data Science Journal 2020) — Essential ethical framework
3. **[Te Hiku Media: Māori Speech Recognition]( — Example of community-led language tech
4. **[Masakhane: Machine Translation for African Languages]( (Orife et al., arXiv 2020) — Participatory NLP for African languages
5. **[Decolonising AI: Indigenous Data Sovereignty]( (Lewis et al., arXiv 2021) — Ethical considerations
[Te Hiku Media Māori Speech Tech]( — Community-led language technology
